title: US Fighters Down More Flying Objects as Tension Ratchets Higher
description: Three flying objects were downed over North America over as many days and another was reportedly spotted over a Chinese port city, showing how “unidentified aerial phenomena” are keeping the world on edge since entering the international mainstream last week.

title: Argentina Says Criminal Groups Are Luring Russian Moms-to-Be
description: Criminal organizations are luring pregnant Russian women into Argentina with so-called childbirth tourism packages, the South American country’s immigration director said on Sunday.

title: Israel President Warns of ‘Constitutional and Social Collapse’
description: President Isaac Herzog of Israel warned in a rare prime-time speech on Sunday that the country is on the verge of “constitutional and social collapse” over a government plan to reduce the power of the judiciary.

title: US Shoots Down Unidentified Object Tracked Over Lake Huron
description: The Pentagon shot down an unidentified object that it tracked over Lake Huron, Michigan, two US officials familiar with the matter said, the fourth time in eight days a high-flying balloon or other craft has been brought down over the US or Canada.

title: US Shoots Down Unidentified Object Over Lake Huron
description: WASHINGTON (AP) — US officials: Unidentified object shot down over Lake Huron Sunday, after Alaska, Canada downings.

title: French Minister Blasts ‘Wakanda Forever’ Over Image of Troops
description: France’s Defense Minister lashed out against the Marvel Studios movie Black Panther: Wakanda Forever over its portrayal of French soldiers, underscoring the sensitivity regarding the country’s military presence in Africa.

title: Airspace Over Lake Michigan Closed Briefly for Military Activity
description: The Federal Aviation Administration briefly closed some airspace over Lake Michigan on Sunday to allow for military activity.

title: Cyprus Ex-Foreign Minister Becomes Island’s New President
description: Nicos Christodoulides was elected president of Cyprus on Sunday, securing his bid to oversee the Mediterranean island whose economy was buffeted first by the pandemic and now by Russia’s war in Ukraine and its associated rise in living costs.

title: Scholz’s Party Loses Berlin Election for First Time Since 1999
description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s Social Democrats lost the Berlin election on Sunday to the conservative Christian Democrats, failing to win the regional vote for the first time in almost 25 years.

title: Schumer Says Banning TikTok in the US ‘Should Be Looked At’
description: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer said a US ban on TikTok is worth looking at, citing Chinese ownership of the company behind the video-sharing platform.

title: France Touts Work From Home in Bid to End Pension Reform Impasse
description: France’s government is open to more concessions on its plan to raise the retirement age by two years, said spokesman Olivier Veran, hinting at a bigger work-from-home push after labor unions threatened to bring the nation to “a halt.”

title: Ex-Foreign Minister Seen Winning Final Cyprus President Vote
description: Nicos Christodoulides won the most votes in the second and final round of Cyprus presidential elections, an exit poll for state broadcaster RIK showed after voting ended.

title: Schumer Says Both Latest Downed Craft Believed to Be Balloons
description: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer said the two latest unidentified objects shot down by US fighter jets over North America were high-altitude balloons.

title: Investors Face Growing Commodities Risk Lurking in ESG Funds
description: The renewables revolution relies on mining for raw materials to power the technology, but supply chains are revealing severe human-rights abuses and environmental damage

title: Turkish Business Group Sees Quakes’ Economic Toll at $84 Billion
description: The two massive earthquakes that killed over 24,000 people in Turkey are expected to result in an loss to the nation’s economy of over $84 billion, or about 10% of the GDP, according to estimates of a business group.

title: Your Sunday UK Briefing: NHS Crisis, Defense Chiefs Meet on Ukraine
description: Follow us at @BloombergUK and on Facebook, and wrap up your day with The Readout newsletter with Allegra StrattonWell, hello again. Here’s what we’re looking at heading into the week. The big guns: Western involvement in Russia’s war on Ukraine is inching ever higher as the invasion nears the one-year mark. The intensity of Russia’s air and ground attacks   is rising too.  A trio of meetings  involving allies will focus on Kyiv’s urgent calls for heavier weaponry and fighter jets to repel Vladim

title: Memes, Tweets, Snark Are the FDA’s New Public Health Weapons
description: When Buffalo Bills safety Damar Hamlin collapsed during a National Football League game in January, dozens of Twitter trolls quickly blamed it on Covid-19 shots.

title: Tories and Labour Hold Secret Brexit Summit: Observer
description: UK politicians and business leaders met in “high secrecy” for a two-day cross-party summit to address the problems caused by Britain leaving the European Union, the Observer reported, citing documents it obtained.

title: China Spots Unidentified Object Flying Near Port City: Paper
description: China is getting ready to take down an unidentified object spotted flying over waters near the port city of Qingdao, The Paper reported.

title: Heathrow Airport Workers Plan to Ballot for Strikes, Union Says
description: Heathrow Airport’s security, engineering and firefighting staff represented by the Unite Union will next week begin balloting for strikes, adding pressure to UK’s transport network which has been hit by a wave of industrial action.

title: Netanyahu Plans ‘Broader Action’ Against Terrorism Supporters
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu pledged to convene the security cabinet on Sunday to prepare for an “broader action” against perpetrators and supporters of terrorism in East Jerusalem and in the West Bank, while avoiding harm to those who are not involved.

title: Malaysian PM’s Daughter Joins Finance Ministry Committee: Star
description: The daughter of Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim will take a role in a finance ministry committee, and step down from her position as a senior adviser to her father, The Star newspaper reported.

title: For Fear or Money, Consumer Giants Are Staying in Russia
description: It’s been nearly a year since Russia invaded Ukraine, but shoppers in Moscow can still get ahold of Activia yogurt and Oral-B electric toothbrushes and L’Oréal serums. Some products are left over from the days before President Vladimir Putin sent troops across the border, but many goods continue to be supplied by American and European companies with outposts in the pariah state.

title: OPEC Chief Tells Climate Activists to ‘Look at the Big Picture’
description: OPEC’s top official urged countries to invest much more in oil to meet the world’s future energy needs and said climate policies need to be more “balanced and fair.”

title: Neutral Austria Under Pressure to Get Tougher on Russia
description: VIENNA (AP) — Austria has come under heavy criticism for granting visas that will allow sanctioned Russian lawmakers to attend a Vienna meeting of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe.

title: Britain’s Cherished NHS Wrestles With Its ‘Reform or Die’ Moment
description: After the pandemic brought the health service to its knees, a host of doctors and scientists and politicians are trying to make it fit for the future.

title: Ukraine Latest: Defense Chiefs Speak Ahead of Ramstein Meeting
description: The intensity of Russia’s military actions, both on the ground in eastern Ukraine and via Friday’s massive missile barrage, seems to be rising as the invasion’s one-year mark approaches.

title: Iranian President to Visit China This Week on Xi’s Invite
description: Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi will make a state visit to China this week on the invitation of Xi Jinping, signaling a strengthening of ties between the two countries as tensions with the US escalate.

title: Macron’s Meloni Snub Shows the Draghi Legacy Starting to Unravel
description: An acrimonious back-and-forth between Italian Prime Minster Giorgia Meloni and French President Emmanuel Macron has laid bare how strained relations are between the two leaders and rolled back years of diplomatic efforts to strengthen ties between the countries.

title: Quake Latest: Turkey Goes After Builders Over Poor Construction
description: Turkey began issuing detention warrants for developers who constructed some buildings that collapsed in two massive earthquakes that struck the southeastern region nearly a week ago.

title: Scholz’s SPD Party Facing Election Setback in Repeat Berlin Vote
description: Olaf Scholz’s Social Democratic Party is expected to suffer a setback in Sunday’s election in Berlin in what would be a blow to the chancellor and SPD Mayor Franziska Giffey.

title: India Discussing Global Crypto Regulation in G-20, Minister Says
description: Nirmala Sitharaman, India's finance minister, speaks during a news conference in New Delhi, India, on Wednesday, Feb. 1, 2023. Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s government unveiled a pre-election India budget that cut personal income taxes to boost consumption while ramping up infrastructure spending to spur growth in an economy touted as a “bright star” amid a gloomy global outlook.

title: NATO Chief Stoltenberg Will Extend Tenure to April 2024: Welt
description: NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg is due to extend his term in office until April 2024, Welt Am Sonntag reported on Sunday.

title: US Reopens Montana Airspace After ‘Radar Anomaly’ Sparks Concern
description: The US reopened airspace over Montana after temporarily ordering a closure to investigate a “radar anomaly,” hours after a third object was shot down in North America this month.

title: Bolsonaro Says He May Return to Brazil in Coming Weeks
description: BRASILIA, Brazil (AP) — Former President Jair Bolsonaro said Saturday he intends to return to Brazil “in the following weeks.”

title: Japan Says Chinese Navy Ship Entered Its Waters Early Sunday
description: Japan’s Defense Ministry said a Chinese navy survey ship was spotted entering the country’s territorial waters early Sunday near Yakushima, an island in the southern Kagoshima prefecture.

title: DOT Attorney Sought Southwest Visit to Check on Meltdown Rebound
description: The top attorney at the US Department of Transportation planned to visit Southwest Airlines Co.’s headquarters as part of an investigation into the carrier’s December operations meltdown that affected more than 2 million people, according to government emails.

title: BBC Chair Made Serious Error by Not Disclosing PM Loan, MPs Say
description: BBC Chairman Richard Sharp made “significant errors of judgment” in failing to disclose his role in a loan to former UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson, risking public trust in the British news organization, a Parliament committee said.
